reviews.review_msg: One of the best profs I have had during my time at SFU. Friendly, knowledgeable, and always willing to help. The course was enjoyable and I would recommend this prof.

The lectures are good and enlightening. He nerds out every so often when he gets excited about a particular subject, but you can see the passion he has for the material. It really makes you respect his teaching ability. Labs were easy, watched videos and reflected on them and the readings. Exam is also easy if you study and pay attention in class.

Great that he wants us to learn to make scientific guesses, but more help with how to develop a good background to do so would be valuable. He's great to talk to, but lectures are a bit random. I guess he's tired of teaching the same old course? I'd rather be guided and pushed a bit more. Time is too short to spend it flailing.

Lance really wants you to excited about what he's teaching.  His lecture notes that you could get before lecture really helped since the textbooks were pretty useful.  Marking was fair, and movies in every tutorials were relaxing

Topics were not well related to lectures and seminars were mostly irrelevant.  It's highly recommended that students select their term paper topics ASAP, as topics were inadequate.  Diminishing class size reflects his teaching ability.
Not bad.  Very knowledgable and passionate but not very helpful individually.  Pretty decent lecturer and his projects are challenging.
Overall pretty intense course but very important material for geography majors.  Exams were easy and the marking was fairly easy for the paper.  Highly recommended course!!
